items.first: 1. At present, the Conflux mainnet upgrade has been completed. FC can be charged into the exchange contract. The pledged FC can be exchanged for the mainnet token CFX with a conversion ratio of 1:1. Once the FC is pledged, the corresponding FC will be permanently destroyed (locked in the contract) . The total number of FC is 2100w, and the official website will provide 2100w CFX is available for users to redeem. Users can put FC into the exchange contract, and the pledged FC can be withdrawn as CFX at any time;
items.second: 2. If the user does not immediately withdraw the CFX, the interest generated in each block of the 2100w CFX that has not been withdrawn from the CFX in the 2100w CFX will be shared according to the proportion of the pledged FC in the total network. The annualized interest is 4%), which is "FC pledged mining";
items.third: 3. Every time the user deposits FC pledge to the exchange contract or withdraws CFX from the exchange contract, the contract will automatically withdraw CFX interest (if CFX interest income is generated) to the user's wallet;
items.fourth: 4. In addition, users who accumulatively pledged 1000FC will get a NFT as a commemorative badge (1 address can get 1 NFT at most);
items.fifth: 5. The exchange of FC pledge to CFX and the interest generated by the pledge are exclusively provided by Conflux.

tip.myNFT: Users who stake amount reaches 1000FC will receive a NFT as a commemorative badge (Each address can get 1 NFT at most)
tip.unsignedFC: Attention: You have {{ value }} FC that is not yet eligible for the subsidy program, please sign up in time!
tip.beforeWithdraw: Please withdraw the interest first, otherwise it will be cleared!
tip.withdrawTitle: To ensure that the user receives interest properly, the agreement must be notified manually after withdrawing the principal.
tip.exchangeTitle: You won't get interest if you don't sign up for a subsidy plan
tip.APY: Calculation formula: Interests-bearing CFX / Current Staked FC * 4%
tip.beforeWithdrawInModal: Please click the "Withdraw Interest" button above before withdrawing your principal, otherwise your interest will be cleared.
tip.beforeExchangeInModal: Clicking this button will permanently convert your FC to CFX and the process is irreversible.

contract.tupleFormat:
Tuple type：{{type}}
Parameter name：{{params}}
Tuple parameter array：{{paramsArray}}
Tuple parameter object：{{paramsObject}}
contract.tupleTips:
Remark: You can refer to Tuple parameter array or Tuple parameter object for tuple input.
Tuple input format should be a JSON array or object that is legal and conforms to the order and format of the parameters. For example, tuple is declared as { uint num; string str; }, then the tuple input format should be: [1, "text"] or { "num": 1, "str": "text" }.
For nested tuples, the input format should be nested JSON array or object that are legal and conform to the parameter order and format. For example, tuples declared as struct A { string name; uint age; } struct B { uint id; A a; }, the tuple B input format should be: [1, ["Tom", 28]] or { "id": 1, "a": {"name": "Tom", "age": 28 }}.

contractDeployment.title: Contract Deployment
contractDeployment.tip: Constructor parameters should have an ABI-ENCODED value, which only accepts contracts that contain constructor parameters.

notice.first: 1. Contract deployment means publishing a contract code to the Conflux network by sending a transaction. Before you deploy the contract, please ensure the CFX balance in your account is sufficient.
notice.second: 2. Only ConfluxStudio, cfxtruffle, remix-compiled .json file imports are supported, and manual copy bytecode (required) and ABI (optional) are supported.
notice.third: 3. You can click on the account in the upper right corner of the page to view the contract deployment details in your transaction history.

notice.first: 1. You can provide transparency to users who interact with a contract by verifying the source code of a contract.
notice.second: 2. ConfluxScan compares the code you upload with the code on the blockchain and the configuration of the code; the contract you upload will pass the verification if the codes are matched successfully.
notice.fourth: 4. Constructor arguments are not supported currently.

sponsor.title: Contract Sponsor
sponsor.providedStorage: Storage Fees Provided By Conflux Foundation
sponsor.providedGas: Gas Fees Provided By Conflux Foundation
sponsor.availStorage: Remaining Storage Fees By Conflux Foundation
sponsor.availGas: Remaining Gas Fees By Conflux Foundation
sponsor.noticeFirst: 1. Conflux Foundation will sponsor Storage and Gas Fees. The amount of the sponsored funds and the application amount may vary.
sponsor.noticeSecond: 2. To request the Smart Contract Sponsorship, you need to connect to ConfluxPortal. After connection you can apply for the sponsorship.
sponsor.noticeFourthOne: 3. If you don't have ConfluxPortal as a browser extension installed yet, please visit
sponsor.noticeFive: 4. If the Foundation sponsors a contract, the upper bound of the gas price is at 10 Gdrip/txn; if the Foundation does not sponsor a contract, there is no cap on the gas price of each transaction.
sponsor.noticeSix: 5. You can apply only if the available storage fee balance is less than 600 CFX or the available gas fee balance is less than 10 CFX.
sponsor.errReachToMax: The available balance storage fees or gas fees has reached or exceeded the maximum value
sponsor.errInsufficientFee: Insufficient storage fees or gas fees by Conflux Foundation
sponsor.errReplaceThird: Unable to replace the third-party sponsors of storage or gas fees
sponsor.errCannotReplaced: Third party sponsors cannot be replaced
sponsor.errUpgraded: Third party sponsors cannot be replaced

addressConverter.title: Address Format Conversion
addressConverter.subtitle: The old Conflux address will be converted to a new address by using the advanced checksum method.
addressConverter.newMainnetAddress: Conflux Tethys new address (both address types are valid)
addressConverter.newTestnetAddress: Conflux Testnet new address (both address types are valid)
addressConverter.newCustomnetAddress: Conflux new address with customized network-id (both address types are valid)
addressConverter.notice: Attention, CFX cannot be transferred directly to the BSC address with any wallet, and cross-chain transfers are required via
addressConverter.tip1: 1. The last eight bits of the new address are checksums, which are generated by the original address through the check algorithm and give the address the ability to self-verify.
addressConverter.tip2: 2. Conflux adopts a new checksum method different from the EIP55 standard.
addressConverter.tip3: 3. The network- id represents the network prefix of the address and is only used for privately deployed Conflux networks. For information about the valid network-id, please visit
addressConverter.tip4: 4. To prevent loss of assets, please review
addressConverter.tip4Middle: Conflux Address-Formats and Their Implications of Asset Transfers

broadcastTx.subtitle: Below you can enter a signed raw transaction in hex format (i.e. characters 0-9, a-f) that starts with 0x and broadcast it over the Conflux network.

mainnet: 1. ConfluxScan is currently on the Mainnet Phase III - Tethys, Conflux-Rust version: {{version}}.
2. ConfluxPortal will be upgraded to v0.6.0 between 11:00 - 13:00 (GMT+8) on March 9th, 2021. After this upgrade, Portal will be fully adapted to CIP-37
3. The new address format is only a conversion of the old format. Users can still log into their Conflux wallet via private keys or secret phrases. User assets will not be affected.
testnet: 1. ConfluxScan is currently on the testnet network, Conflux-Rust version: {{version}}, all data shown are from the testnet.
2. ConfluxPortal will be upgraded to v0.6.0 between 11:00 - 13:00 (GMT+8) on March 9th, 2021. After this upgrade, Portal will be fully adapted to CIP-37
3. The new address format is only a conversion of the old format. Users can still log into their Conflux wallet via private keys or secret phrases. User assets will not be affected.

block.blockHeight: The number of blocks on the path to Genesis block via parent references. The block height of a newly mined block is obtained by increasing the height of its parent block by 1. In particular, the block height of Genesis block is 0.
block.epoch: Epoch refers to the block height of the first pivot block that (directly or indirectly) references this block. The epoch number of a block represents the time when this block is first observed by pivot blocks. A block in an earlier epoch always precedes blocks in later epoches in the total order of all blocks.
block.difficulty: The amount of effort required to mine a new block. The difficulty may adjust according to time.
block.miner: Miner who successfully generate the block onto the blockchain.
block.reward: The miner of this block is rewarded with a finite amount of CFX, consists of base reward, reward from storage collateral interest and transaction fee.
block.security: The security of block, higher security requires more block confirmations.
block.blame: The number of consecutive ancestor blocks whose state commitments are incorrect and need revision. The state commitments can be realized as digests of transaction execution receipts and account status. An incorrect state commitment may affect the miner's reward, but has nothing to do with the consensus of total order of all blocks.
block.blockHash: The hash of the block header of the current block.
block.parentHash: The hash of the block from which this block was generated, also known as its parent block.
block.nonce: Block nonce is a value used during mining to demonstrate proof of work for a block.
block.gasUsedLimit: The exact units of gas that was used for the transaction; Maximum amount of gas provided for the transaction.
block.timestamp: The date and time at which a block is mined.
block.size: The block size is actually determined by the block's gas limit.
block.transactions: The amout of transactions which belong to the block.
block.referenceBlocks: The other blocks referred by the current block.

tx.transactionHash: A TxHash or transaction hash is a unique 66 characters identifier that is generated whenever a transaction is executed.
tx.executedEpoch: The epoch when the transaction is actually executed.
tx.proposedEpoch: The epoch that the sender wants the transaction to be executed. The transaction cannot be executed in epochs of number more than 100,000 from the proposed epoch number.
tx.timestamp: The date and time at which a transaction is mined.
tx.security: The security of block, higher security requires more block confirmations.
tx.from: The sending party of the transaction (could be from a contract address).
tx.to: The receiving party of the transaction (could be a contract address).
tx.tokenTransferred: List of token transferred in the transaction.
tx.value: The value being transacted in CFX.
tx.gasUsedLimit: The exact units of gas that was used for the transaction; Maximum amount of gas provided for the transaction.
tx.gasPrice: Cost per unit of gas specified for the transaction in GDrip. The higher the gas price the higher chance of getting included in a block.
tx.gasFee: The exact fee of gas that was used for the transaction.
tx.gasCharged: Conflux protocol requires that the gas-charged should be at least 3/4 of the gas limit. Usually, gas-charged equals the gas used. But if the gas used is less than 3/4 of the gas limit, gas-charged equals 3/4 of the gas limit.
tx.nonce: Sequential running number for an address, beginning with 0 for the first transaction. For example, if the nonce of a transaction is 10, it would be the 11th transaction sent from the sender's address.
tx.blockHash: A block hash is a unique 66 characters identifier that is generated whenever a transaction is executed.
tx.position: Index position of Transaction in the block.
tx.storageLimit: Storage Used ÷ 1024 = Storage Collateralize Fee; Maximum amount of storage(byte) the sender is willing to pay for storage collateral.
tx.storageCollateralized: The cost of storage that needs to be paid.
tx.storageReleased: The refund of storage collateralize fees.
tx.chainID: The ID indicating which blockchain this transaction is meant to send to. Provides protection against replay-attack.
tx.inputData: Additional information that is required for the transaction.

address.balance: The amout of assets which belong to the address.
address.token: The amout of tokens which belong to the address.
address.storageCollateral: The amount of storage collaterals paid by the current address, the unit is the CFX.
address.nonce: Sequential running number for an address, beginning with 0 for the first transaction. For example, if the nonce of a transaction is 10, it would be the 11th transaction sent from the sender's address.
address.stakingEarned: Staking CFX Earned (APY 4%) does not contain withdrawn interest. Staked interest will be automatically sent to your wallet address each time it is withdrawn.
address.lockedEnd: to lock CFX for voting rights.
address.currentVotingRights: The voting rights will be awarded according to: number of quarters × number of tokens × 0.25.

token.volume: The total dollar value of all cryptocurrency transactions over the past 24 hours.
token.marketCap: The market value of a cryptocurrency's total supply. Market Cap = Current Price x Total Supply.
token.fullyDilutedMarketCap: The market cap if the max supply was in circulation. Fully-diluted market cap = price x max supply.
token.holders: The amount of addresses which hold the token.
token.transfers: The amount of token transactions which belongs to the address.
token.contract: The contract which deploys the token.

contract.balance: The amount of assets which belongs to the address.
contract.token: The amount of tokens which belongs to the address.
contract.storageCollateral: The amount of storage collaterals paid by the contract sponsor, the unit is the CFX.
contract.nameTag: Name tags can be attached to an address for identifying addresses of interest.
contract.tokenTracker: The token which was deployed by the contract.
contract.contractCreator: The address which deploys the contract.
contract.contractAdmin: The address which owns the contract administration authority. The admin is able to destroy the contract. (Tethys zero address: cfx:aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa0sfbnjm2; Testnet zero address: cfxtest:aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa6f0vrcsw)
contract.storageSponsor: The sponsor address which pays storage collateral for transactions interacts with such a contract.
contract.gasFeeSponsor: The sponsor address which pays gas fee for transactions interacts with such a contract.
